### closeFile {#a43548658b3d92c080577422f81f38038}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::error&#95;code llvm::sys::fs::closeFile (<a href="#a8ec705e6a361f51bca14123110ecb75d">file&#95;t</a> &amp; F)</>}>
Close the file object.

This should be used instead of ::close for portability. On error, the caller should assume the file is closed, as is the case for <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/process/#a0777b5060c78b24c4765fffbac259f93">Process::SafelyCloseFileDescriptor</a>


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="F">On input, this is the file to close. On output, the file is set to kInvalidFile.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
An error code if closing the file failed. Typically, an error here means that the filesystem may have failed to perform some buffered writes.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/filesystem-h/#l01206">1206</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/filesystem-h">FileSystem.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### createTemporaryFile {#ab15b20ec21b28d9674608fd5aecc64de}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::error&#95;code llvm::sys::fs::createTemporaryFile (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Prefix, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Suffix, int &amp; ResultFD, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; char &gt; &amp; ResultPath, <a href="#a662978c0cdf81de0d448032f142a3695">OpenFlags</a> Flags=<a href="#a662978c0cdf81de0d448032f142a3695a8ae6a0a158ab49e5bbe92cbc2cabcbcd">OF&#95;None</a>)</>}>
Create a file in the system temporary directory.

The filename is of the form prefix-random&#95;chars.suffix. Since the directory is not know to the caller, Prefix and Suffix cannot have path separators. The files are created with mode 0600.

This should be used for things like a temporary .s that is removed after running the assembler.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/path-cpp/#l00863">863</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/path-cpp">Path.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### createUniqueFile {#a7efe580e0855b9d68d0b884b79ebf955}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::error&#95;code llvm::sys::fs::createUniqueFile (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Model, int &amp; ResultFD, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; char &gt; &amp; ResultPath, <a href="#a662978c0cdf81de0d448032f142a3695">OpenFlags</a> Flags=<a href="#a662978c0cdf81de0d448032f142a3695a8ae6a0a158ab49e5bbe92cbc2cabcbcd">OF&#95;None</a>, unsigned Mode=<a href="#ac56b6ec1078927bdd9b65f7ba8fbda82ab5e842a50787e803e6e66bc9cc73f634">all&#95;read</a>|<a href="#ac56b6ec1078927bdd9b65f7ba8fbda82a1c2301837e9bfe7c9c8421b540d92822">all&#95;write</a>)</>}>
Create a uniquely named file.

Generates a unique path suitable for a temporary file and then opens it as a file. The name is based on <em>Model</em> with &#39;&#39; replaced by a random char in &#91;0-9a-f&#93;. If <em>Model</em> is not an absolute path, the temporary file will be created in the current directory.

Example: clang-%%-%%-%%-%%-%%.s =&gt; clang-a0-b1-c2-d3-e4.s

This is an atomic operation. Either the file is created and opened, or the file system is left untouched.

The intended use is for files that are to be kept, possibly after renaming them. For example, when running &#39;clang -c foo.o&#39;, the file can be first created as foo-abc123.o and then renamed.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Model">Name to base unique path off of.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="ResultFD">Set to the opened file&#39;s file descriptor.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="ResultPath">Set to the opened file&#39;s absolute path.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Flags">Set to the opened file&#39;s flags.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Mode">Set to the opened file&#39;s permissions.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
errc::success if Result&#123;FD,Path&#125; have been successfully set, otherwise a platform-specific error&#95;code.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/path-cpp/#l00822">822</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/path-cpp">Path.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### createUniqueFile {#aaa2438d37d4ecc8548a9bd7773907d16}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::error&#95;code llvm::sys::fs::createUniqueFile (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Model, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; char &gt; &amp; ResultPath, unsigned Mode=<a href="#ac56b6ec1078927bdd9b65f7ba8fbda82ab5e842a50787e803e6e66bc9cc73f634">all&#95;read</a>|<a href="#ac56b6ec1078927bdd9b65f7ba8fbda82a1c2301837e9bfe7c9c8421b540d92822">all&#95;write</a>)</>}>
Simpler version for clients that don&#39;t want an open file.

An empty file will still be created.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/path-cpp/#l00829">829</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/path-cpp">Path.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### createUniquePath {#aa37537b95a42a73ea04d8dd2803378da}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::sys::fs::createUniquePath (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Model, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; char &gt; &amp; ResultPath, bool MakeAbsolute)</>}>
Create a potentially unique file name but does not create it.

Generates a unique path suitable for a temporary file but does not open or create the file. The name is based on <em>Model</em> with &#39;&#39; replaced by a random char in &#91;0-9a-f&#93;. If <em>MakeAbsolute</em> is true then the system&#39;s temp directory is prepended first. If <em>MakeAbsolute</em> is false the current directory will be used instead.

This function does not check if the file exists. If you want to be sure that the file does not yet exist, you should use enough &#39;&#39; characters in your model to ensure this. Each &#39;&#39; gives 4-bits of entropy so you can use 32 of them to get 128 bits of entropy.

Example: clang-%%-%%-%%-%%-%%.s =&gt; clang-a0-b1-c2-d3-e4.s


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Model">Name to base unique path off of.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="ResultPath">Set to the file&#39;s path.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="MakeAbsolute">Whether to use the system temp directory.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/path-cpp/#l00796">796</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/path-cpp">Path.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

 (= 0)

<EnumerationListItem name="OF_CRLF">

<EnumerationListItem name="OF_Delete">

The caller is responsible for closing the file object once they are finished with it.

<ParametersListItem name="Flags">Additional flags.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Mode">The access permissions of the file, represented in octal.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

### readNativeFile {#a32bbe4415129895140f4c407345eb9d1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Expected&lt; size&#95;t &gt; llvm::sys::fs::readNativeFile (<a href="#a8ec705e6a361f51bca14123110ecb75d">file&#95;t</a> FileHandle, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mutablearrayref">MutableArrayRef</a>&lt; char &gt; Buf)</>}>
Reads <code>Buf.size()</code> bytes from <code>FileHandle</code> into <code>Buf</code>.

Returns the number of bytes actually read. On Unix, this is equivalent to <code>return ::read(FD, / Buf.data(), Buf.size())</code>, with error reporting. Returns 0 when reaching EOF. 

<CodeBlock>
@param FileHandle File to read from.
@param Buf Buffer to read into.
@returns The number of bytes read, or error. 
</CodeBlock>

### readNativeFileToEOF {#a25241903dcf363fdf53dc9e8f1037e7a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error llvm::sys::fs::readNativeFileToEOF (<a href="#a8ec705e6a361f51bca14123110ecb75d">file&#95;t</a> FileHandle, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; char &gt; &amp; Buffer, ssize&#95;t ChunkSize=<a href="#a1b610e8a6953259207f401155cceefffadca0a9d4e89fbc03d4d52f4a003de582">DefaultReadChunkSize</a>)</>}>
Reads from <code>FileHandle</code> until EOF, appending to <code>Buffer</code> in chunks of size <code>ChunkSize</code>.

This calls <em><a href="#a32bbe4415129895140f4c407345eb9d1">readNativeFile()</a></em> in a loop. On <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a>, previous chunks that were read successfully are left in <code>Buffer</code> and returned.

Note: For reading the final chunk at EOF, <code>Buffer&#39;s</code> capacity needs extra storage of <code>ChunkSize</code>.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="FileHandle">File to read from.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Buffer">Where to put the file content.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="ChunkSize">Size of chunks.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
The error if EOF was not found.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/path-cpp/#l01174">1174</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/path-cpp">Path.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### tryLockFile {#a2b8ef26c55540747c5f83d0cd898fe92}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::error&#95;code llvm::sys::fs::tryLockFile (int FD, std::chrono::milliseconds Timeout=std::chrono::milliseconds(0))</>}>
Try to locks the file during the specified time.

This function implements advisory locking on entire file. If it returns <em>errc::success</em>, the file is locked by the calling process. Until the process unlocks the file by calling <em>unlockFile</em>, all attempts to lock the same file will fail/block. The process that locked the file may assume that none of other processes read or write this file, provided that all processes lock the file prior to accessing its content.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="FD">The descriptor representing the file to lock.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Timeout">Time in milliseconds that the process should wait before reporting lock failure. Zero value means try to get lock only once.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
errc::success if lock is successfully obtained, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a59739a4f15fb2ec57a6b7fcfe938546ba58688487c3e24313637a76bd29881e64">errc::no&#95;lock&#95;available</a> if the file cannot be locked, or platform-specific error&#95;code otherwise.
</SectionUser>


:::info
Care should be taken when using this function in a multithreaded context, as it may not prevent other threads in the same process from obtaining a lock on the same file, even if they are using a different file descriptor.
:::

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/filesystem-h/#l01182">1182</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/filesystem-h">FileSystem.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### create&#95;link {#a104eea5a51402274ef2499a3ee6c64b8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::error&#95;code llvm::sys::fs::create&#95;link (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; to, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; from)</>}>
Create a link from <em>from</em> to <em>to</em>.

The link may be a soft or a hard link, depending on the platform. The caller may not assume which one. Currently on windows it creates a hard link since soft links require extra privileges. On unix, it creates a soft link since hard links don&#39;t work on SMB file systems.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="to">The path to hard link to.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="from">The path to hard link from. This is created.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
errc::success if the link was created, otherwise a platform specific error&#95;code.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/filesystem-h/#l00322">322</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/filesystem-h">FileSystem.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### resize&#95;file&#95;before&#95;mapping&#95;readwrite {#a432aad8e94857a0e03a0b8dfb9447fe0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::error&#95;code llvm::sys::fs::resize&#95;file&#95;before&#95;mapping&#95;readwrite (int FD, uint64&#95;t Size)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Resize <code>FD</code> to <code>Size</code> before mapping <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/fs/mapped-file-region/#a7d087bce12e64c2578f57ca0e1884919afbac192dfef7b435728686ff9f82dad5">mapped&#95;file&#95;region::readwrite</a></em>.

On non-Windows, this calls <em><a href="#a809a1f7126692d11a59a6122ae70e300">resize&#95;file()</a></em>. On Windows, this is a no-op, since the subsequent mapping (via <code>CreateFileMapping</code>) automatically extends the file.
